meanings.definition: Based on personal feelings or opinions rather than facts.
meanings.sent1: Her taste in music is very subjective.
meanings.sent2: The movie reviews were subjective and varied greatly.
meanings.sent3: His subjective view of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of color was so subjective, it felt like a dream.
meanings.sent5: The subjective nature of memories can be both beautiful and confusing.

meanings.definition: Existing in the mind; belonging to the thinking subject rather than to the object of thought.
meanings.sent1: The dream had a subjective quality that was hard to shake off.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often discuss the subjective experience of reality.
meanings.sent3: The cat's subjective belief that it was a lion amused everyone.
meanings.sent4: The subjective boundaries between reality and fantasy blurred in the story.
meanings.sent5: The subjective perception of time can vary greatly from person to person.
